bestBHT.bht: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things shall be added unto you. This verse, closely related to Matthew 6:33, emphasizes the importance of prioritizing the kingdom of God above all else. By seeking God's kingdom and living a righteous life, we can trust that our needs will be provided for. This includes the essentials of life, such as food and clothing, which are sufficient for our enjoyment. It is a reminder that seeking godliness and contentment with what we have is of great gain.

Archibald T. Robertson: See Matthew 6:33 for this verse. Luke does not have "first" nor "his righteousness" nor "all."
John Gill: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God...."
And all these things shall be added unto you; food and raiment, which are as much as can be enjoyed..."
...godliness with these, and contentment with them is great gain.

bhtAttempts.bht: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things shall be added unto you. This verse, closely related to Matthew 6:33, emphasizes the importance of prioritizing the kingdom of God above all else. By seeking God's kingdom and living a righteous life, we can trust that our needs will be provided for. This includes the essentials of life, such as food and clothing, which are sufficient for our enjoyment. It is a reminder that seeking godliness and contentment with what we have is of great gain.

By seeking the kingdom of God and his righteousness, we can find contentment and gain the essentials of life. This aligns with Matthew 6:33, which highlights the importance of prioritizing the kingdom of God. Luke's version of the verse omits certain phrases found in Matthew, emphasizing the simplicity of seeking God and his righteousness. This reminds us that our needs will be provided for when we focus on seeking godliness and finding contentment in what we have.

By seeking the kingdom of God and his righteousness, we can trust that our needs will be provided for. This includes the essentials of life, such as food and clothing, which are sufficient for our enjoyment. It is a reminder that seeking godliness and contentment with what we have is of great gain. Luke's version of the passage does not include certain phrases found in Matthew, but the emphasis remains on prioritizing the kingdom of God and living a righteous life.

By seeking the kingdom of God and his righteousness, we can trust that our needs will be provided for. This includes the essentials of life, which are sufficient for our enjoyment. It is a reminder that seeking godliness and contentment with what we have is of great gain. Luke's version emphasizes prioritizing the kingdom of God and living a righteous life.

By seeking the kingdom of God and his righteousness, we can trust that our needs will be provided for. This emphasizes prioritizing the kingdom of God and living a righteous life, as seeking godliness and contentment with what we have is of great gain. Luke's version of this teaching simplifies the message from Matthew, highlighting the importance of focusing on God and not being consumed by the pursuit of worldly desires.
